title: Arceuus spellbook

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Arceuus spellbook, sometimes referred to as the necromancy spellbook, is a spellbook that players can access upon gaining 60% favour with Arceuus in Great Kourend. Like the standard spellbook, it has a variety of combat and utility spells at its disposal, unlike the Lunar spellbook, which is primarily focused on utility spells, and the Ancient Magicks, which is heavily combat-oriented.

content:
The Arceuus spellbook.

The Arceuus spellbook, sometimes referred to as the necromancy spellbook, is a spellbook that players can access upon gaining 60% favour with Arceuus in Great Kourend. Like the standard spellbook, it has a variety of combat and utility spells at its disposal, unlike the Lunar spellbook, which is primarily focused on utility spells, and the Ancient Magicks, which is heavily combat-oriented.

Making extensive use of blood, nature and soul runes, this spellbook is notable for its reanimation spells used in prayer training, and is also known for its vast array of teleportation spells which primarily transport players to destinations associated with death, such as graveyards and dungeons occupied by the undead. In addition, a larger set of combat and utility spells are accessible to players who have completed the quest, A Kingdom Divided.

Because of the low supply of law runes within the kingdom, the study of teleportation magicks has always been very limited throughout Great Kourend's history, with Xeric being the only known user of teleportation spells. However, with a larger wave of visitors from the mainland arriving to Great Kourend, a steady supply of law runes became available, allowing Arceuus to create teleportation spells to many places.

Contents

  • 1 Switching spellbooks
  • 2 Teleportation spells
  • 3 Combat spells
    • 3.1 Autocasting
    • 3.2 Grasp spells
    • 3.3 Demonbane spells
    • 3.4 Corruption spells
    • 3.5 Resurrection spells
    • 3.6 Other spells
  • 4 Utility spells
    • 4.1 Reanimation spells
    • 4.2 Offering spells
    • 4.3 Other spells
  • 5 Discontinued spells
  • 6 Unused spells
  • 7 Changes

Switching spellbooks[edit | edit source]

Players may speak with Tyss to switch to the Arceuus spellbook. Tyss can be found near the Dark Altar on the north end of Arceuus. Players can get to Tyss by using the fairy ring code CIS; however, the fairy ring needs to be unlocked by speaking to the nearby NPC, Trossa, for a one time fee of 80,000 after unlocking the use of fairy rings in the Fairytale II - Cure a Queen quest. Another option is to use the games necklace teleport to the Wintertodt Camp and run south-west until the snowy area exit, then run east afterwards.

Alternatively, players who have level 80 Construction can build a dark altar within their Achievement Gallery, allowing them to freely switch between the standard and Arceuus spellbooks without having to travel to the real Dark Altar.

Teleportation spells[edit | edit source]

A player uses a teleport spell from the Arceuus spellbook.

Players are free to use all teleportation spells upon unlocking the Arceuus spellbook; completion of A Kingdom Divided is not required.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Notes
Arceuus Home Teleport 1 None 0 Teleports the player to the Dark Altar.
Arceuus Library Teleport 6 2 1 9 Teleports the player north of the Arceuus Library.
Draynor Manor Teleport 17 1 1 1 16 Teleports the player to Draynor Manor.
Battlefront Teleport 23 1 1 1 19 Teleports the player to the Ancient Grave, just beyond the Battlefront.
Mind Altar Teleport 28 1 2 22 Teleports the player to the Mind Altar whose entrance is near the Wilderness.
Respawn Teleport 34 1 1 27 Teleports the player to their current respawn point.
Salve Graveyard Teleport 40 1 2 30 Teleports the player to the ghoul area by the entrance to Mort Myre Swamp. Requires completion of Priest in Peril. This is the closest teleport in the game to an overworld Fairy Ring.
Fenkenstrain's Castle Teleport 48 1 1 1 50 Teleports the player to Fenkenstrain's Castle. Requires completion of Priest in Peril.
West Ardougne Teleport 61 2 2 68 Teleports the player to the West Ardougne graveyard. Requires completion of Biohazard.
Harmony Island Teleport 65 1 1 1 74 Teleports the player to Harmony Island. Requires completion of The Great Brain Robbery.
Cemetery Teleport 71 1 1 1 82 Teleports the player to The Forgotten Cemetery in the Wilderness.
Barrows Teleport 83 1 2 2 90 Teleports the player to the Barrows. Requires completion of Priest in Peril.
Ape Atoll Teleport 90 2 2 2 100 Teleports the player to the Ape Atoll Dungeon. Requires completion of Monkey Madness I, including having received Daero's training

Combat spells[edit | edit source]

The combat spells of the Arceuus spellbook possess a mix of offensive and support spells, which includes spells to resurrect thralls, which fight alongside the player for a set amount of time.

With the exception of Ghostly Grasp and Inferior Demonbane, all combat spells in the Arceuus spellbook require completion of the quest A Kingdom Divided.

Autocasting[edit | edit source]

Offensive Arceuus spells can only be autocast with particular magic weapons:

Skull sceptre
Ahrim's staff
Slayer's staff[n 1]
Staff of the dead
Toxic staff of the dead
Master wand
Kodai wand
  1. â†‘ Includes the enchanted variant.

Grasp spells[edit | edit source]

Grasp spells deal damage and provide a chance to stop the target from moving for a short time. Successful hit chance and the duration applied are doubled on targets that are under the effects of the Mark of Darkness spell. However, if the target is under the effect of the Ward of Arceuus spell, they will only be bound in place for 0.6 seconds if successfully bound by the caster.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Damage Bind
chance 		Bind time
(seconds)
Ghostly Grasp 35 4 1 22.5 12 10% 1.2
Skeletal Grasp 56 8 1 33 17 25% 1.8
Undead Grasp 79 12 1 46.5 24 50% 2.4

Demonbane spells[edit | edit source]

Demonbane spells deal damage (with a 20% accuracy bonus) much like any other offensive spells, but can only be cast on demonic creatures. They will have an additional 25% damage and 40% accuracy bonus if cast on demons that are under the effects of the Mark of Darkness spell.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Damage
Inferior Demonbane 44 4 1 27 16
Superior Demonbane 62 8 1 36 23
Dark Demonbane 82 12 2 43.5 30

Corruption spells[edit | edit source]

Corruption spells provide a chance to inflict corruption on the caster's next successful hit. If a player with corruption spells active attacks an opposing player with Ward of Arceuus active, the attacker's corruption spells will remain active until the target's Ward expires, after which the next successful attack post-expiration will roll the chance for corruption.

Players cannot cast corruption spells on a player if they are currently corrupted, nor can they do so while the target is under the effects of the Ward of Arceuus spell. There is no immunity period after corruption wears off on a player.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Corruption
chance
Lesser Corruption 64 1 2 75 33%
Greater Corruption 85 1 3 95 66%

Resurrection spells[edit | edit source]

Requires having the book of the dead equipped or in the player's inventory (which is obtained upon completion of A Kingdom Divided), casting resurrection spells require prayer points in addition to runes, and will summon a thrall that attacks the same target that the player is attacking for a certain amount of time ( 0.6 ∗ Magic Level {\displaystyle 0.6*{\text{Magic Level}}} seconds).

Players can only summon one thrall at a time, and it cannot attack other players. Thralls have an attack speed of 4 (attacking every 2.4 seconds), cannot be damaged, and ignore accuracy checks when attacking.

These spells cannot be used at Basilisk Knights or within the Chasm of Fire.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Prayer
points cost 		Thrall
attack style 		Thrall
max hit
Resurrect Lesser Ghost 38 10 1 5 55 2 Magic 1
Resurrect Lesser Skeleton 38 10 1 5 55 2 Ranged 1
Resurrect Lesser Zombie 38 10 1 5 55 2 Melee 1
Resurrect Superior Ghost 57 10 1 5 70 4 Magic 2
Resurrect Superior Skeleton 57 10 1 5 70 4 Ranged 2
Resurrect Superior Zombie 57 10 1 5 70 4 Melee 2
Resurrect Greater Ghost 76 10 5 1 88 6 Magic 3
Resurrect Greater Skeleton 76 10 5 1 88 6 Ranged 3
Resurrect Greater Zombie 76 10 5 1 88 6 Melee 3

Other spells[edit | edit source]

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Description
Dark Lure 50 1 1 60 Lures monsters to attack players, and stops them from retreating. Can also be cast on implings.
Mark of Darkness 59 1 1 70 Gives various debuffs to the target that lasts for a set amount of time.
Ward of Arceuus 73 1 2 4 83 Gives various buffs to oneself that lasts for a set amount of time.

Utility spells[edit | edit source]

With the exception of Resurrect Crops and reanimation spells, all utility spells in the Arceuus spellbook require completion of the quest A Kingdom Divided.

Reanimation spells[edit | edit source]

Main article: Reanimation spells

Reanimation spells will reanimate certain creatures whose heads still contain their souls. Killing reanimated creatures will grant Arceuus favour for each reanimated creature killed based on their toughness. Players are awarded Magic experience for casting the spell, and Prayer experience for killing the reanimated creature. A majority of reanimated creatures will have a maximum of 35 Hitpoints.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Compatible ensouled heads
Basic Reanimation 16 4 2 32 Goblin, monkey, imp, minotaur, scorpion, bear, unicorn
Adept Reanimation 41 4 3 1 80 Dog, chaos druid, ogre, giant, elf, troll, horror
Expert Reanimation 72 1 3 2 138 Kalphite, dagannoth, bloodveld, TzHaar, demon
Master Reanimation 90 2 4 4 170 Aviansie, abyssal demon, dragon

Offering spells[edit | edit source]

Offering spells convert up to three sets of remains to prayer points, granting three times the normal experience of burying or scattering remains. They take the same amount of time as offering three remains at an altar in a player-owned house chapel.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Remains converted
Demonic Offering 84 1 1 175 Ashes
Sinister Offering 92 1 1 180 Bones

Other spells[edit | edit source]

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Description
Shadow Veil 47 5 5 5 58 Grants a 15% chance (36.25% if wearing the dodgy necklace) to avoid being stunned and damaged while pickpocketing NPCs for a set amount of time.
Vile Vigour 66 3 1 76 Converts remaining prayer points into run energy at a 1:1 ratio.
Degrime 70 4 2 83 Cleans all grimy herbs in the player's inventory that the player has the Herblore level to clean.
Resurrect Crops 78 25 8 12 8 90 Gives a chance for a dead farming patch to be brought back to life. If the spell fails, the patch is cleared out.
Death Charge 80 1 1 1 90 Restores 15% of the player's special attack energy upon killing a monster.

Discontinued spells[edit | edit source]

The Arceuus spellbook prior to the merging of reanimation spells.

With an update on 28 April 2021, the spellbook was significantly reduced in size to prepare for the release of the quest A Kingdom Divided.

There were formerly reanimation spells for each ensouled head, which were merged into four reanimation spells in the update. In addition, the Lumbridge Graveyard Teleport was replaced with the Arceuus Library Teleport.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP
Reanimate Goblin 3 2 1 6
Lumbridge Graveyard Teleport 6 2 1 9
Reanimate Monkey 7 3 1 14
Reanimate Imp 12 3 2 24
Reanimate Minotaur 16 4 2 32
Reanimate Scorpion 19 1 1 38
Reanimate Bear 21 1 1 1 42
Reanimate Unicorn 22 2 1 1 44
Reanimate Dog 26 2 2 1 52
Reanimate Chaos Druid 30 3 2 1 60
Reanimate Giant 37 4 2 1 74
Reanimate Ogre 40 4 3 1 80
Reanimate Elf 43 2 2 2 86
Reanimate Troll 46 3 2 2 92
Reanimate Horror 52 4 2 2 104
Reanimate Kalphite 57 4 3 2 114
Reanimate Dagannoth 62 4 3 3 124
Reanimate Bloodveld 65 1 2 2 130
Reanimate TzHaar 69 1 3 2 138
Reanimate Demon 72 1 4 2 144
Reanimate Aviansie 78 1 4 3 156
Reanimate Abyssal Creature 85 1 4 4 170
Reanimate Dragon 93 2 4 4 186

Unused spells[edit | edit source]

Some spells designs were cut from the Arceuus spellbook rework, although Mod West had still made spell icons for them and can be found within the game cache.

  • A bone conversion spell

  • A teleport spell to the Wilderness

  • Mobile icon

  • A resurrection spell

  • Mobile icon

  • A corruption spell

  • Mobile icon

  • A spell resembling Magic Dart

  • A red demonbane spell (mobile)

  • A yellow-green demonbane spell (mobile)

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 June 2021
(update)
  • Demonbane spells now have a 20% accuracy bonus, increasing to 40% for demonic creatures under the effects of the Mark of Darkness spell.
  • An animation will now play when a target is no longer under the effects of the Mark of Darkness spell.
  • Offering spells are now cast instantly, and have a cooldown timer before it can be cast again.
  • Death Charge now restores special attack energy when fighting the Grotesque Guardians.
16 June 2021
(update | poll)
  • New combat spells and utility spells have been added to the spellbook, most of which require completion of A Kingdom Divided to cast.
  • The spellbook icon was graphically updated.
28 April 2021
(update | poll)
  • Reanimation spells were merged into four spells.
  • The Lumbridge Graveyard Teleport spell was replaced with the Arceuus Library Teleport spell.
  • Various teleport spell icons were graphically updated.
10 January 2019
(update)

The Battlefront Teleport spell was added.

11 October 2018
(update)

The spellbook icons for reanimation spells were graphically updated.

18 February 2016
(update)

The spellbook is now referred to as the "Arceuus spellbook" instead of the "Necromancy spellbook".

29 January 2016
(update)
  • Teleport spells in the Arceuus spellbook now use combination runes correctly.
  • Casting the Resurrect Crops spell after having used Spellbook Swap will now swap the spellbook back.
28 January 2016
(update | poll)
  • Eleven teleport spells were added to the spellbook.
  • The Resurrect Crops spell has been added.

[[File:Arceuus spells.png|frame|The Arceuus spellbook.]] [[File:Arceuus spellbook.png|left|The Arceuus spellbook icon.]] The '''Arceuus spellbook''', sometimes referred to as the '''necromancy spellbook''', is a [[spellbook]] that players can access upon gaining 60% [[favour]] with [[Arceuus]] in [[Great Kourend]]. Like the [[standard spellbook]], it has a variety of combat and utility spells at its disposal, unlike the [[Lunar spellbook]], which is primarily focused on utility spells, and the [[Ancient Magicks]], which is heavily combat-oriented. [[File:Arceuus icon detail.png|left|120px]] Making extensive use of [[blood rune|blood]], [[nature rune|nature]] and [[soul rune]]s, this spellbook is notable for its [[reanimation spells]] used in [[prayer training]], and is also known for its vast array of [[teleportation]] spells which primarily transport players to destinations associated with death, such as graveyards and dungeons occupied by the [[undead]]. In addition, a larger set of combat and utility spells are accessible to players who have completed the quest, [[A Kingdom Divided]]. Because of the low supply of [[law rune]]s within the kingdom, the study of teleportation magicks has always been very limited throughout [[Great Kourend]]'s history, with [[Xeric]] being the only known user of teleportation spells. However, with a larger wave of visitors from the mainland arriving to Great Kourend, a steady supply of law runes became available, allowing Arceuus to create teleportation spells to many places. ==Switching spellbooks== Players may speak with [[Tyss]] to switch to the Arceuus spellbook. Tyss can be found near the [[Dark Altar]] on the north end of [[Arceuus]]. Players can get to Tyss by using the [[fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|CIS}}; however, the fairy ring needs to be unlocked by speaking to the nearby NPC, [[Trossa]], for a one time fee of {{Coins|80,000}} after unlocking the use of fairy rings in the [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen]] [[quest]]. Another option is to use the [[games necklace]] teleport to the [[Wintertodt Camp]] and run south-west until the snowy area exit, then run east afterwards. Alternatively, players who have level 80 [[Construction]] can build a [[Dark altar (Construction)|dark altar]] within their [[Achievement Gallery]], allowing them to freely switch between the standard and Arceuus spellbooks without having to travel to the real [[Dark Altar]]. ==Teleportation spells== [[File:Arceuus teleport.gif|thumb|150px|A player uses a teleport spell from the Arceuus spellbook.]] Players are free to use all teleportation spells upon unlocking the Arceuus spellbook; completion of [[A Kingdom Divided]] is not required. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:800px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]

Successful hit chance and the duration applied are doubled on targets that are under the effects of the [[Mark of Darkness]] spell. (seconds) |- |[[File:Ghostly Grasp.png]] |[[File:Ghostly Grasp icon (mobile).png]] |[[Ghostly Grasp]] |35 |{{RuneReq|Air=4|Chaos=1}} |22.5 |12 |10% |1.2 |- |[[File:Skeletal Grasp.png]] |[[File:Skeletal Grasp icon (mobile).png]] |[[Skeletal Grasp]] |56 |{{RuneReq|Earth=8|Death=1}} |33 |17 |25% |1.8 |- |[[File:Undead Grasp.png]] |[[File:Undead Grasp icon (mobile).png]] |[[Undead Grasp]] |79 |{{RuneReq|Fire=12|Blood=1}} |46.5 |24 |50% |2.4 |} ===Demonbane spells=== Demonbane spells deal damage (with a 20% accuracy bonus) much like any other offensive spells, but can only be cast on [[demonic creatures]]. They will have an additional 25% damage and 40% accuracy bonus if cast on demons that are under the effects of the [[Mark of Darkness]] spell. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:700px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]
icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP !Damage |- |[[File:Inferior Demonbane.png]] |[[File:Inferior Demonbane icon (mobile).png]] |[[Inferior Demonbane]] |44 |{{RuneReq|Fire=4|Chaos=1}} |27 |16 |- |[[File:Superior Demonbane.png]] |[[File:Superior Demonbane icon (mobile).png]] |[[Superior Demonbane]] |62 |{{RuneReq|Fire=8|Soul=1}} |36 |23 |- |[[File:Dark Demonbane.png]] |[[File:Dark Demonbane icon (mobile).png]] |[[Dark Demonbane]] |82 |{{RuneReq|Fire=12|Soul=2}} |43.5 |30 |} ===Corruption spells=== Corruption spells provide a chance to inflict [[Corruption (status)|corruption]] on the caster's next [[successful hit]]. If a player with corruption spells active attacks an opposing player with [[Ward of Arceuus]] active, the attacker's corruption spells will remain active until the target's Ward expires, after which the next successful attack post-expiration will roll the chance for corruption. Players cannot cast corruption spells on a player if they are currently corrupted, nor can they do so while the target is under the effects of the [[Ward of Arceuus]] spell. There is no immunity period after corruption wears off on a player. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:700px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]
icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP !Corruption
chance |- |[[File:Lesser Corruption.png]] |[[File:Lesser Corruption icon (mobile).png]] |[[Lesser Corruption]] |64 |{{RuneReq|Death=1|Soul=2}} |75 |33% |- |[[File:Greater Corruption.png]] |[[File:Greater Corruption icon (mobile).png]] |[[Greater Corruption]] |85 |{{RuneReq|Blood=1|Soul=3}} |95 |66% |} ===Resurrection spells=== Requires having the [[book of the dead]] equipped or in the player's inventory (which is obtained upon completion of [[A Kingdom Divided]]), casting resurrection spells require [[prayer points]] in addition to runes, and will summon a [[thrall]] that attacks the same target that the player is attacking for a certain amount of time (0.6 * \text{Magic Level} seconds). Players can only summon one thrall at a time, and it cannot attack other players. Thralls have an [[attack speed]] of 4 (attacking every 2.4 seconds), cannot be damaged, and ignore accuracy checks when attacking. These spells cannot be used at Basilisk Knights or within the Chasm of Fire. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:700px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]

icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP !Description |- |[[File:Dark Lure.png]] |[[File:Dark Lure icon (mobile).png]] |[[Dark Lure]] |50 |{{RuneReq|Nature=1|Death=1}} |60 |Lures monsters to attack players, and stops them from [[retreat]]ing. Can also be cast on [[impling]]s. |- |[[File:Mark of Darkness.png]] |[[File:Mark of Darkness icon (mobile).png]] |[[Mark of Darkness]] |59 |{{RuneReq|Cosmic=1|Soul=1}} |70 |Gives various debuffs to the target that lasts for a set amount of time. |- |[[File:Ward of Arceuus.png]] |[[File:Ward of Arceuus icon (mobile).png]] |[[Ward of Arceuus]] |73 |{{RuneReq|Cosmic=1|Nature=2|Soul=4}} |83 |Gives various buffs to oneself that lasts for a set amount of time. |} ==Utility spells== With the exception of [[Resurrect Crops]] and [[reanimation spells]], all utility spells in the Arceuus spellbook require completion of the quest [[A Kingdom Divided]]. ===Reanimation spells=== {{main|Reanimation spells}} Reanimation spells will reanimate certain creatures whose [[ensouled head|heads]] still contain their souls. Killing reanimated creatures will grant [[Arceuus]] favour for each reanimated creature killed based on their toughness. Players are awarded [[Magic]] experience for casting the spell, and [[Prayer]] experience for killing the reanimated creature. A majority of reanimated creatures will have a maximum of 35 [[Hitpoints]]. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:700px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]
icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP !Compatible [[ensouled head]]s |- |[[File:Basic Reanimation.png]] |[[File:Basic Reanimation icon (mobile).png]] |[[Basic Reanimation]] |16 |{{RuneReq|Body=4|Nature=2}} |32 |[[Ensouled goblin head|Goblin]], [[Ensouled monkey head|monkey]], [[Ensouled imp head|imp]], [[Ensouled minotaur head|minotaur]], [[Ensouled scorpion head|scorpion]], [[Ensouled bear head|bear]], [[Ensouled unicorn head|unicorn]] |- |[[File:Adept Reanimation.png]] |[[File:Adept Reanimation icon (mobile).png]] |[[Adept Reanimation]] |41 |{{RuneReq|Body=4|Nature=3|Soul=1}} |80 |[[Ensouled dog head|Dog]], [[Ensouled chaos druid head|chaos druid]], [[Ensouled ogre head|ogre]], [[Ensouled giant head|giant]], [[Ensouled elf head|elf]], [[Ensouled troll head|troll]], [[Ensouled horror head|horror]] |- |[[File:Expert Reanimation.png]] |[[File:Expert Reanimation icon (mobile).png]] |[[Expert Reanimation]] |72 |{{RuneReq|Nature=3|Blood=1|Soul=2}} |138 |[[Ensouled kalphite head|Kalphite]], [[Ensouled dagannoth head|dagannoth]], [[Ensouled bloodveld head|bloodveld]], [[Ensouled tzhaar head|TzHaar]], [[Ensouled demon head|demon]] |- |[[File:Master Reanimation.png]] |[[File:Master Reanimation icon (mobile).png]] |[[Master Reanimation]] |90 |{{RuneReq|Nature=4|Blood=2|Soul=4}} |170 |[[Ensouled aviansie head|Aviansie]], [[Ensouled abyssal head|abyssal demon]], [[Ensouled dragon head|dragon]] |} ===Offering spells=== Offering spells convert up to three sets of remains to [[prayer points]], granting three times the normal experience of burying or scattering remains. They take the same amount of time as offering three remains at an altar in a [[player-owned house]] [[chapel]]. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:700px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]

icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP !Description |- |[[File:Shadow Veil.png]] |[[File:Shadow Veil icon (mobile).png]] |[[Shadow Veil]] |47 |{{RuneReq|Earth=5|Fire=5|Cosmic=5}} |58 |Grants a 15% chance (36.25% if wearing the [[dodgy necklace]]) to avoid being [[Stun (status)|stunned]] and damaged while [[pickpocketing]] [[NPC]]s for a set amount of time. |- |[[File:Vile Vigour.png]] |[[File:Vile Vigour icon (mobile).png]] |[[Vile Vigour]] |66 |{{RuneReq|Air=3|Soul=1}} |76 |Converts remaining [[prayer points]] into [[run energy]] at a 1:1 ratio. |- |[[File:Degrime.png]] |[[File:Degrime icon (mobile).png]] |[[Degrime]] |70 |{{RuneReq|Earth=4|Nature=2}} |83 |Cleans all grimy [[herbs]] in the player's inventory that the player has the [[Herblore]] level to clean. |- |[[File:Resurrect Crops.png]] |[[File:Resurrect Crops icon (mobile).png]] |[[Resurrect Crops]] |78 |{{RuneReq|Soul=8|Nature=12|Blood=8|Earth=25}} |90 |Gives a chance for a dead [[farming patch]] to be brought back to life. If the spell fails, the patch is cleared out. |- |[[File:Death Charge.png]] |[[File:Death Charge icon (mobile).png]] |[[Death Charge]] |80 |{{RuneReq|Death=1|Blood=1|Soul=1}} |90 |Restores 15% of the player's [[special attack]] energy upon killing a monster. |} ==Discontinued spells== [[File:Arceuus spells pre-merge.png|frame|The Arceuus spellbook prior to the merging of reanimation spells.]] With [[Update:Arceuus Spellbook Beta and A Kingdom Divided Preparation|an update]] on [[28 April]] [[2021]], the spellbook was significantly reduced in size to prepare for the release of the quest [[A Kingdom Divided]]. There were formerly reanimation spells for each [[ensouled head]], which were merged into four reanimation spells in the update. In addition, the [[Lumbridge Graveyard Teleport]] was replaced with the [[Arceuus Library Teleport]]. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:500px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]

demobane spell (mobile).png|A yellow-green demonbane spell (mobile) ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 30 June 2021 |update = Phosani's Nightmare |poll = |change = * Demonbane spells now have a 20% accuracy bonus, increasing to 40% for demonic creatures under the effects of the [[Mark of Darkness]] spell. * An animation will now play when a target is no longer under the effects of the Mark of Darkness spell. * Offering spells are now cast instantly, and have a cooldown timer before it can be cast again. * Death Charge now restores special attack energy when fighting the [[Grotesque Guardians]]. }} {{Subject changes |date = 16 June 2021 |update = A Kingdom Divided |poll = A Kingdom Divided |change = * New [[combat spells]] and [[utility spells]] have been added to the spellbook, most of which require completion of [[A Kingdom Divided]] to cast. * The spellbook icon was graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes |date = 28 April 2021 |update = Arceuus Spellbook Beta and A Kingdom Divided Preparation |poll = A Kingdom Divided |change = * Reanimation spells were merged into four spells. * The Lumbridge Graveyard Teleport spell was replaced with the Arceuus Library Teleport spell. * Various teleport spell icons were graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes |date = 10 January 2019 |update = The Kebos Lowlands |change = The Battlefront Teleport spell was added. }} {{Subject changes |date = 11 October 2018 |update = Spellbook Rework, Wise Old Man and, Increased Zoom |change = The spellbook icons for reanimation spells were graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes |date = 18 February 2016 |update = Dragon Claws & 3rd Birthday |change = The spellbook is now referred to as the "Arceuus spellbook" instead of the "Necromancy spellbook". }} {{Subject changes |date = 29 January 2016 |update = System Update (29 January 2016) |change = * Teleport spells in the Arceuus spellbook now use combination runes correctly. * Casting the Resurrect Crops spell after having used [[Spellbook Swap]] will now swap the spellbook back. }} {{Subject changes |date = 28 January 2016 |update = Necromancy Improvements |poll = Old School Content Poll 38: Jad II, Deadman & Zeah |change = * Eleven teleport spells were added to the spellbook. * The Resurrect Crops spell has been added. }} {{Subject changes footer}} {{Spellbooks}}
